__data__.text:
Everything ordered was delicious. All of the accompanying dips and sauces for the dishes were perfection. The Doogh cocktail is memorable and goes down maybe too easily! Do NOT miss the saffron cookie ice cream sandwich - it’s outstanding!
"Defiantly the best Persian restaurant in nyc!

My husband and I love going here! Kashk o Bademjan, ghormeshabzi, kabab kobideh, lamb rack and the duck is our favorites! Honestly everything taste amazing! You can’t go wrong!"
One of the best restaurants in the city. Worth traveling from Manhattan. Everything is excellent. Your friends will think you are a master of cuisine for bringing them here, I can speak for experience because that is exactly how I think of my friend Griffin who introduced me to this place.
Beautiful interiors and decor but food seemed pricey.
$10 for a beer on tap smh. We had the Komaj bread, Kabob Koobideh and Chicken Kabob. The chicken kabob had too many berries for our taste, to the point you couldn't really taste anything other than the berries. Service was good but overall I'd say overpriced.
By far the best fine dining restaurant I’ve tried it’s absolutely amazing. The dips and barberry rice stood out
"(Translated by Google) 2023NYT Top 100 Restaurants in New York. Overall very good, recommended 🥰

Barbari bread - almost every table ordered, very popular on google maps/yelp. As soon as I tasted it, isn't this the taste of northern biscuits from snacks to big ones! ? This biscuit is delicious, but I have definitely had better biscuits. This makes me wonder if opening a biscuit shop in Manhattan will be very popular 😁

Lamb chops - the meat is very soft and rotten, and the fat and lean are not bad.

Saffron Ice Cream Sandwich - Best Review! The fragrance of this rose is too strong 😮 It may be even more fragrant than Jiahua Flower Cake.

(Original)
2023NYT纽约百佳餐厅。整体非常不错，推荐🥰

Barbari bread - 基本上每桌都点了，google maps/yelp上非常受欢迎。我一尝，这不就是从小吃到大的北方烧饼的味儿吗！？这个饼是很香，但我绝对吃过更好的烧饼。这不禁让我想在曼哈顿开个烧饼店是不是会很有市场😁

羊排 - 肉非常软烂，而且肥瘦相间不柴。

藏红花冰淇淋三明治 - 最好评！这个玫瑰香的太浓郁了😮可能比嘉华鲜花饼还要更香。"
So good
Incredible in every way! One of the most memorable evenings in NY I have had in decades - a place of consistent quality, memories of home and one to come back to! Thank you Team Eyval! 😍🌺🤗
Food and service were outstanding. Portions were generous.
Very Friendly services.  And good place for dine in.  I would recommend it.
Everything was delicious. Food combined classical Persian dishes with a modern twist. We ordered the lamb, date salad,

- 最好评！这个玫瑰香的太浓郁了😮可能比嘉华鲜花饼还要更香。"
So good
Incredible in every way! One of the most memorable evenings in NY I have had in decades - a place of consistent quality, memories of home and one to come back to! Thank you Team Eyval! 😍🌺🤗
Food and service were outstanding. Portions were generous.
Very Friendly services.  And good place for dine in.  I would recommend it.
Everything was delicious. Food combined classical Persian dishes with a modern twist. We ordered the lamb, date salad, kashk, and koobideh and everything was delicious. The baklava and ice cream sandwiches were amazing also
Awesome choice of food, friendly staff, great tasting food. Highly recommend 👌
Really fantastic, great food, great service.
Had wanted to go here since it opened and it did not disappoint. We shared a few different dishes and all of it was amazing.
One of my favorite restaurants right now. The food, the cocktails and the ambiance is all so good.
The bread are really good. The lamb ribs are very well cooked with unique flavor. Not something you can find everywhere. Every dip is presented like a small piece of art. Beautiful plates and silverware as well.
"🥣Food: 4.7
💃Vibe: 4.6
🍹Drinks: 4.1
💰Price: 3.9
💎Cleanliness: 4.5
Total: 4.36 / 5 ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Eyval, the Persian hotspot born from the same team behind Sofreh, shares a certain aesthetic DNA with its sister restaurant. However, with LED Farsi lettering on the walls and saffron ice cream sandwiches on the menu, Eyval definitely has its own unique vibe.

It's the perfect place to have a chill date or hang with your squad when you want to keep things effortlessly cool. The food is stylish and on-point, and the atmosphere is just right for a dinner that complements your mood.

Make sure to try the Spring Borani yogurt with the must-have Persian flatbread, barbari. While the Mushroom Kabob may not be to everyone's taste (although I personally enjoyed it), the duck and date rice is a true masterpiece. And let me tell you, the Gheymeh Nesar is a real sleeper hit that you won't want to miss out on.

In short, come for the food, stay for the vibe, and keep the party going at one of the nearby Bushwick bars."
Probably the best Persian restaurant in NYC - the attention to detail on every single dish is incredible. Service was wonderful as well, would definitely come back! Highlights were both the breads, mushroom kabob, and whipped feta!
Excellent Persian food respecting the classic dishes with an innovative twist. Kashk-E-Bademjan, duck rice, the lamb and potato tahdig were some of the highlights. The mushroom kebab and the cream puff desert were also good.
Amazing experience. Had a large assortment of the bread, apps, and mains and all were excellent. The standouts were the kefta kabab, lamb shank, duck rice, and chicken kabab.
Excitedly waited 2 weeks for Tuesday reservation. The atmosphere lived up to expectations. Service was extremely slow. First course was delicious. The rest was disappointing. We specified how to course our choices, and instead we received 3 courses which didn't make sense for 2 people. By the time our $45 entrees arrived we had waited too long, and filled up on the "second course" which ALSO included a huge bowl of rice. Poor service on the server's part.
An amazing meal from start to finish. Lots of carbs rice included with entrees. Yogurt a great contrast to the meat.

experience. Had a large assortment of the bread, apps, and mains and all were excellent. The standouts were the kefta kabab, lamb shank, duck rice, and chicken kabab.
Excitedly waited 2 weeks for Tuesday reservation. The atmosphere lived up to expectations. Service was extremely slow. First course was delicious. The rest was disappointing. We specified how to course our choices, and instead we received 3 courses which didn't make sense for 2 people. By the time our $45 entrees arrived we had waited too long, and filled up on the "second course" which ALSO included a huge bowl of rice. Poor service on the server's part.
An amazing meal from start to finish. Lots of carbs rice included with entrees. Yogurt a great contrast to the meat. Lamb chops were very tender and juicy. Butter on the kabob, lamb shank, potato, all delicious. Can see when the sister restaurant is nominated for JBA.
"Ey-Val has been getting a lot of buzz so I decided to see for myself.

Started with the Albaloo Reviver which was one of the tastiest cocktails i've had in recent memory. Tequila based, not too sweet. Definitely go for this one.

First plate we shared was the Barbari Bread with the Persian Shallot Yogurt. After mentioning to my girlfriend that it ""tasted like an elevated everything bagel with veggie cream cheese"" I can't unthink that now. I mean that in the best way possible because EVERYTHING about it was delicious.

The next two things I had were the Lamb Ribs & Scallop Kabob. The Lab Ribs were fall-off-the-bone finger-licking GOOD. The tamarind-date glaze had the right amount of richness and paired well with the sliced peppers on top. The Scallop Kabob was also killer. The squid ink / chili base was a little bit tart but it made the dish more fun and interesting. The scallops were cooked to perfection.

They were out of the Whipped Feta and Potato Tahdig so I suggest going early in the night.

I will definitely be back!"
"Wonderful food at a cute place. If you order multiple tapas, they can come out a little slow. Recommend 3-4 dishes per person (except for their entree items). Cocktail is interesting and worth trying!

I highly recommend their bread, whipped feta, lamb ribs, and veal shank."
Eyval serves well made tasty food. Nothing in the menu is Groundbreaking, but also not generic. It’s a great option for a special occasion or a date night with the right atmosphere for a candlelight dinner. The cream puffs were a highlight and are not to be missed.
"Super Nice restaurant great staff and service.
Great food. We showed up without reservation at saturday night and they made it for us.
I recommend this excellent place."
Outstanding meal. Every dish was complex and incredibly flavorful while maintaining impeccable balance.
Amazing Iranian food! I brought my friends here for Nowruz and we had a blast, everything we ordered was impeccable. I was mind blown, esp since there's not a lot of Iranian restaurants like this- with this quality and atmosphere. I just want to thank everyone involved in creating this restaurant<3
The very best lamb dishes in nyc
What a fantastic restaurant. That saffron martini is so good and the food is out of this world
Outstanding. Best meal we've had in a long time. Everything was fantastic - take a group so you can try a bit of everything.
"Service was wonderful!!
Food was just so heavy, salty, acidic and unbalanced imo.

The whole meal I was dying for some sweet or some neutrality.

Idk tho - just for $200 for 2, I expected way better"
"Food was PHENOMENAL. The eggplant dish and the saffron ice cream were definite standouts.

While the food was great, the service could improve. I dined here alone (no reservation), and I was left

to thank everyone involved in creating this restaurant<3
The very best lamb dishes in nyc
What a fantastic restaurant. That saffron martini is so good and the food is out of this world
Outstanding. Best meal we've had in a long time. Everything was fantastic - take a group so you can try a bit of everything.
"Service was wonderful!!
Food was just so heavy, salty, acidic and unbalanced imo.

The whole meal I was dying for some sweet or some neutrality.

Idk tho - just for $200 for 2, I expected way better"
"Food was PHENOMENAL. The eggplant dish and the saffron ice cream were definite standouts.

While the food was great, the service could improve. I dined here alone (no reservation), and I was left waiting over 15 minutes with the dessert menu before even placing my order (which was taken by a kind food runner who noticed I was forgotten by the server). As a solo diner this was pretty annoying, especially considering the cell service is almost nonexistent in the restaurant.

Additionally, the only table available was in a corner facing the wall. Absolutely hated the way the seating was arranged facing a wall and away from the rest of the restaurant.

Despite those hiccups, the experience was overall a good one- and I will be back again soon as the food was really so good."
"Nice place, great food, small portion tho,
Clean area and Lydia was very nice and made our night.
We will come back soon.
Thank you"
"Tart smooth fresh yogurt runs through the menu. Wonderfully fresh vegetable focused menu.

The mushroom kebob being one of the standout dishes.  Surprisingly the Koobideh was not the star but I found lots of pleasure in the eggplant.

The scallop in squid ink was also descendant with a hint of spice"
Get ghalye mahi 😍😍
Amazing bartender named Renna, unimpressive place otherwise
"Great experience that got over shadowed by the darker sides of the restaurant biz.

Walked in with my partner due to the aesthetic allure, surprisingly we got bar seating. We were led through the menu adeptly by our two knowledgeable and personable bartenders: Renna and Lydia. They managed to hold great conversation with us while their hands stayed busy, masterfully preparing drinks/handling bar food for a fully packed restaurant. The food was amazing but what really made it worth it was having such great genuine human connection.

All that being said it was deeply disturbing when at the end of our meal as we were about to leave, our bartender Renna was fired. She had done such a great job promoting the restaurant and had even talked about how much she loved her job–it showed in her work ethic. The rest of the staff looked visibly shaken up and afraid afterwards–seemingly as shocked as we were. I was looking forward to making this restaurant a regular spot for us when we visit the city. However, I cannot in good conscious seeing how the management cuts corners for their bottom line at their workers' expense leaving them blindsided, without livelihood and uncertain in this economy. I am grateful for having met both Renna and Lydia. I hope she finds a better job and I hope eyval management realizes that the menu doesn't make the experience–people do."
was visiting ny for the weekend and came here on a whim with my partner. dinner and drink recommendations were spot on and the bar service was amazing, super friendly! one of my most warm and memorable dining experiences thanks to Renna and Lydia who were bartending that night. it definitely soured our experience when Renna disappeared and we discovered she had suddenly been fired on the spot. given how excellent her service was for us + our new bar friends next to us, I can't imagine why. was planning on returning but as someone who worked in restaurant industry for many years, I can't in good conscience patron a restaurant that treats their best people as disposable. Really unfortunate and wishing her the best.
Tasty Persian fusion - though I miss

make the experience–people do."
was visiting ny for the weekend and came here on a whim with my partner. dinner and drink recommendations were spot on and the bar service was amazing, super friendly! one of my most warm and memorable dining experiences thanks to Renna and Lydia who were bartending that night. it definitely soured our experience when Renna disappeared and we discovered she had suddenly been fired on the spot. given how excellent her service was for us + our new bar friends next to us, I can't imagine why. was planning on returning but as someone who worked in restaurant industry for many years, I can't in good conscience patron a restaurant that treats their best people as disposable. Really unfortunate and wishing her the best.
Tasty Persian fusion - though I miss the original recipes. Attentive staff and a beautiful vibe.
"Had a fantastic meal - everything was delicious! I would call the food more persian-inspired meals (with a mix of mediterranean). I’d advise choosing elsewhere if you are looking for a truly authentic Persian experience.

Loved the twist on ghalieh mahi with scallops, and the bread just melted in my mouth.

Incredibly friendly servers and bartenders. And KC the host was so kind and helpful."
Expect to have your dinner conversation interrupted by the (delightfully) unexpected flavor play, the skillful orchestration, and the positively transportative quality of the food here.  The chic, rustic sterility of the atmosphere belies the extravagant celebration that is its food. Every dish at Eyval, from the seemingly simple Persian shallot yogurt to the wonderfully complex gheymeh nesar, will demand your full attention—and reward it in kind.
Delicious food! Great vibe inside. Good cocktails/drinks.
Food is incredible. So rich, so deliciously and carefully prepared. Definitely need a reservation though.
This place is fire. Everything is good. Order with abandon, but make sure you get the lamb ribs 🥵
The food was average but the vibes are not good the place is so tiny and they squeeze tables next to each other you keep hearing other peoples conversations and the staff seems  to be a little cranky I’ll probably give it another try
"Over rated place service was decent the clown that did the host job-didn’t have an idea what he was doing food was less
Then average I could have made better myself,I  don’t recommend it at all if I could give less than one star I would ."
Excellent. I haven’t had a meal like this in a while. Don’t trust the waiter: the plates are generous, they’re not tiny! But order as many as you want since every dish was flavorful and delicious.
Phenomenal flavor profiles with each dish. Really well balanced
Amazing experience! This was actually my introduction into Persian food and I loved every dish. The Whipped Feta Spread + Persian Shallot Yogurt with their bread is DELICIOUS. Lamb Ribs were like eating Mexican candy because the spice and sweet ratio was godly. They tasted very rich. Enjoyed the Hanger steak with the sauce they provide.
Great ribs. But also chewy octopus, intollerably orange-y lamb on a $40 price tag, cocktails you won’t finish, and a slow slow slow service that defeats the whole point of small dishes. Also a 15 min standing wait after reservation time. Bah
i’ve been to Eyval three times now and sadly the best word to sum it up is uneven . . . the food can be brilliant or disappointing. the staff fantastic or dismissively haughty.  i want to love this restaurant but can’t.
Too too expensive 😪
This is one of our favorite places in the city. The food was incredible, everything was amazing. Service was also A+. Very strongly recommend this place. It is a bit of a hike for us but so worth it.
One of the best new restaurants in Bushwick! Amazing Persian

intollerably orange-y lamb on a $40 price tag, cocktails you won’t finish, and a slow slow slow service that defeats the whole point of small dishes. Also a 15 min standing wait after reservation time. Bah
i’ve been to Eyval three times now and sadly the best word to sum it up is uneven . . . the food can be brilliant or disappointing. the staff fantastic or dismissively haughty.  i want to love this restaurant but can’t.
Too too expensive 😪
This is one of our favorite places in the city. The food was incredible, everything was amazing. Service was also A+. Very strongly recommend this place. It is a bit of a hike for us but so worth it.
One of the best new restaurants in Bushwick! Amazing Persian food. The meats are incredible but the real star of the show are the yogurt dips and bread. SO good, the dip with broccoli rabe and pistachios is absolutely addicting. The koobideh was incredible and the lamb chops were unreal. Really cool vibes in the restaurant, perfect for a date night or a dinner with friends. Cannot recommend this place enough!
Everything about this place is good. Great flavors, professional and friendly staff. An amazing looking kitchen as well.
"OK! I need a moment of silence to realize what I ate!!! OMG! This place was the bessssst!
I’m %100 sure you wouldn’t find another restaurant like this.
Everything was perfect, I mean it!!! From the first drink until the end.
We did our best to try most of the food (which was impossible; they had many options)!
I had the best drinks, Persian food, and dessert here.
And I have to admit their decor was so unique, and you’ll see a lot of touches from Iran.
Definitely recommend this place. 🤩"
Amazing food and ambiance. Staff was knowledgeable and did a great job of guiding us throughout our meal. All the appetizers were amazing and the veal entree was a standout. Would jump at an opportunity to come back.
The vibe of the restaurant is amazing, with a cozy and inviting atmosphere that makes you feel right at home. The drinks menu is also fantastic, featuring an impressive selection of mezcal cocktails that are expertly crafted and absolutely delicious. But the real star of the show at Eyval is the food. The Fesenjoon and Koobideh were absolutely amazing, and I highly recommend both dishes. Overall, I would give Eyval my highest recommendation and encourage anyone looking for a great dining experience to check it out.
Fantastic!!! The food was delicious, the staff super nice and friendly. Great atmosphere and music! I highly recommend!
"Eyval broke the spell of experiencing mediocre to bad restaurants. Everything from the appearance and decoration to the menu and the actual foods and drinks surprised me and all my companies. The creativity in appropriating Iranian dish did not upset us! Quite the opposite, we enjoyed how well-thought every single item on the menu was.

There were a few items that were okay, such as the drink with Aperol, or the size of barbari bread (very tiny!), or the absence of dates from Kumaj, but overall, the menu was creative and delicious more than anything else. I would say the dessert menu could be much richer given the variety of Iranian huge variation of sweets though.

Most items are good for one person, even the entrees that are supposedly to be shared, so the price might be a little high. But again, the extent we enjoyed our food in that atmosphere was so high that I easily can overlook the downsides and keep visiting Eyval forever!"
Honestly fantastic. Cocktails, food, all of it. Everything was delicious. Ordered two breads, one dip, 3 appetizer-y dishes and 1 entree. Was a lot of food for two people but we still ate it all, haha. Instantly knew I'd be back again...and again and again.
Prices are high but service is

but overall, the menu was creative and delicious more than anything else. I would say the dessert menu could be much richer given the variety of Iranian huge variation of sweets though.

Most items are good for one person, even the entrees that are supposedly to be shared, so the price might be a little high. But again, the extent we enjoyed our food in that atmosphere was so high that I easily can overlook the downsides and keep visiting Eyval forever!"
Honestly fantastic. Cocktails, food, all of it. Everything was delicious. Ordered two breads, one dip, 3 appetizer-y dishes and 1 entree. Was a lot of food for two people but we still ate it all, haha. Instantly knew I'd be back again...and again and again.
Prices are high but service is awful. They were out of many menu items.
One of the best restaurants in NYC.
This place was beyond amazing. The service was spectacular and the food was incredibly flavorful. Everything was perfectly cooked and there was so much love and thought put into each plate. The atmosphere was super lively and romantic. Perfect for a special occasion with family, friends or loved ones. Great drinks as well with wonderful persian flavors
Outstanding. One of my favorite restaurants in NY at the moment. The breads and dips are delicious, as is the Saffron Martini. The Kashke Bademjan is incredibly savory and umami-rich. The latifeh and tea are a great way to finish off the meal.
Interesting concept but eyval just didn’t get it right. Not one Persian works there and they have no hedgehog concept. They are banking on tourists and rich locals to take in the ambience and although the inside is very homey and they are playing old Persian films, the food is mediocre at best. They don’t even have masto khiyar and the portions are small and where is the Persian experience with sumac, ghormeh sabzi etc? Contact me if you want some guidance as I had two Persian restaurants in the VA area. 180 dollar bills for two people and mediocre food will only get you one time customers.
Incredibly delicious & thoughtful food, drinks, service - a truly cohesive vision.
Perfect location for a surprise B-day celebration
Food was pretty good. The waiter was very nice
"The food was incredible. Every single dish had depth and nuance.

I was not impressed by the cocktails, especially at their price point."
Amazing food
Really impressed and pleased with the food and service at Eyval. We were running late and couldn’t get a hold of the restaurant (no phone) so our table was given away. Despite that, Casey and Cat made every attempt to accommodate us. The service was phenomenal and the food was so good that we can’t wait to come back again. Thank you  to the team for being so kind and serving us so quickly. Truly appreciated their generosity!
"This place is great! The restaurant is a bit far from me, located in the heart of Bushwick. But the trip out was worth it!

Great Persian food. We ordered quite a few dishes including a tomato salad, the whipped feta, beef and chicken kebab, and a lamb heart salad (really good!). We didn't have reservations but came as soon as the restaurant opened at 6p and were able to secure a seat at the bar. The staff was super friendly and helpful throughout the meal and we really enjoyed it.

If you're in the area, highly recommend this restaurant! Great find and will be back"
While visiting my brother, we tried eyval. This is nouveau Persian cuisine. At first glance i wasn’t sure if I would like it, but boy was I quickly proven wrong. It is food I had during my childhood but with a sophisticated twist. For those who know Persian cuisine, you would know that all Persians love a stew called ghormesabzi, Eyval took this dish an elevated it. Instead of having cubed beef in it. They place a beautiful osso bucco in

but came as soon as the restaurant opened at 6p and were able to secure a seat at the bar. The staff was super friendly and helpful throughout the meal and we really enjoyed it.

If you're in the area, highly recommend this restaurant! Great find and will be back"
While visiting my brother, we tried eyval. This is nouveau Persian cuisine. At first glance i wasn’t sure if I would like it, but boy was I quickly proven wrong. It is food I had during my childhood but with a sophisticated twist. For those who know Persian cuisine, you would know that all Persians love a stew called ghormesabzi, Eyval took this dish an elevated it. Instead of having cubed beef in it. They place a beautiful osso bucco in the middle of the plate sured with the stew. What an amazing concept. Every dish they have,  is elevated Persian food. From their kashke bademjan to their kabab koobideh. Very well thought concept. Very cool ambiance, and a very interesting menu. A must try.
Fantastic food, great experience
The best lamb I have ever had…… and I eat way too much lamb
Delicious from start to finish. I can’t remember the last time I went to a restaurant and loved everything—not a single dish wasn’t stellar.  For 4 people we got the shallot yogurt, two Barbari bread, roasted squash, Khashkeh badimjoon, koobideh, grilled octopus, duck fesenjoon, and…can’t remember the name but it was like an upleveled airy whoopie pie. Can’t wait to come back.
Amazing food and extremely nice staff
When I arrived with my party of 4 at 7pm on Thursday, I was flustered to find that I had messed up my reservation. The floor manager really didn't have room for us with the existing reservations for the night but finagled her bookings to squeeze us into a table. She then expedited our food so that we could fully enjoy the menu for our allotted 75 minutes. The food was absolutely fantastic, full of bright flavors, wonderful bursts of acidity and perfectly cooked proteins. Highly recommend both breads, the lamb salad, roasted eggplant, hamachi and the scallops. Drinks were also great but what I'll remember most is the service. Thank you Eyval team for being so hospitable!!
"Great dining experience. Delicious food. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff, nice decor and friendly atmosphere.

My only surprise was that they didn’t use their platform to raise awareness around the social injustices issues transpiring in iran right now. A simple banner , a #mahsa amini or anything"
"We experienced this amazing cuisine couples weeks ago and it were phenomenal & delicious.
Highly recommended and definitely will come back!"
Eyval is my favorite restaurant in New York and the best Iranian restaurant in US! As an Iranian I try to go to as many iranian restaurant as I can when I travel but this time I went back twice to this place because it’s that good! Everything was great but I do recommend getting the squash salad before they take it out of their menu and the season is gone 👌
EVERYTHING IS super good
Place was empty but they wouldn't seat us for 2.5 hours
The food is so so delicious, the service is a 10/10, and the ambiance is great. I can’t wait to go back!
This place is fantastic. The kebab is not to be missed! Such cute decor and ambiance. Can’t wait to go back
"We stopped by here for the first time for our anniversary. The environment is warm and friendly. The kitchen has glass walls and is visible to everyone. As a Persian, I had the best Gourmet Sabzi of my life. The latifeh sweet was also amazing.

Our only complaint is that different staff kept on taking away our dishes while we were eating and we had to stop them. It was really annoying and ruined the experience for us. Hope the management address it!!!"
Average

was empty but they wouldn't seat us for 2.5 hours
The food is so so delicious, the service is a 10/10, and the ambiance is great. I can’t wait to go back!
This place is fantastic. The kebab is not to be missed! Such cute decor and ambiance. Can’t wait to go back
"We stopped by here for the first time for our anniversary. The environment is warm and friendly. The kitchen has glass walls and is visible to everyone. As a Persian, I had the best Gourmet Sabzi of my life. The latifeh sweet was also amazing.

Our only complaint is that different staff kept on taking away our dishes while we were eating and we had to stop them. It was really annoying and ruined the experience for us. Hope the management address it!!!"
Average food with premium price.
The old fashioned was overly fragrant and unbalanced, not enough gin. The yogurt dips require bread and the bread is $6-8 a piece which is absurd. Scallops were cooked incredibly well but served with a flavorful dip that required… bread or rice to balance it out (which did not come with the dish, IMO should have).  Eggplant lamb dish just wasn’t a winner.  Chilled house red was good.  Probs won’t be back.
Took my wife who is Persian. She loved it. I loved it.
Insanely good
can't wait to come back and try some different dishes
"I had the best Persian food ever here 🥲
You must try their “Eggplant and cured yoghurt,” “tahdig and plum sauce,” “gheyme bademjan,” “ghalie mahi.” Oh and don't forget to try their Komaj bread and for dessert have the Latifah, you'll love its texture and how delicious it is."
the food, design, service and everything about this place is my favorite!
Really great food. Great atmosphere, slightly over the top pricing, but in the end worth every penny
Excellent food, ‘new’ well composed flavors. Beautiful interior. Traditional wines may be hard to go with the distinct flavors. Our server was just a bit too eager to up sell that night 🤭
Excellent all around
All the dishes I had was amazing and the balance of taste of food was perfect 👍🏼 Enjoyed time while we were having food and definitely I will come and try again if I come back to New York 😁
